page.title: 19Oliver Cromwell
page.content: At the end of{Woolden Road}(which is on Cadishead Moss) there is a house in which, it is rumoured,{Oliver} {Cromwell}lived. It is called{Great} {Woolden Hall,}and is very big. The present owner said, "People say he lived here but there isn't any proof." The house is over{five hundred years} {old. Woolden Hall}used to be one big house but now it is three separate buildings. A part of the house which is now the barn was rebuilt in{1865} because it was falling down. The age of the building means that it has still got cobbles on the floor outside. The three separate buildings are{1. The house itself,}where the presnt owners live.{2. The cowshed, where they milk and feed the cows.{3.} {The old barn}where they keep the machinery and stack all the hay.
